intro: Hemitelia squamulosa, commonly known as the silver-leaved hemitelia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking silver-gray foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it requires careful attention to its specific growing conditions.
